intro: Gelseminum, commonly known as the yellow rose of Jericho, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters at the ends of its stems. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Gelseminum is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with a deep root system that allows it to store water efficiently.
